description: Users may experience a total loss of connectivity when the Windows Network Driver Interface Specification (NDIS) is impacted. This results in a complete inability to access network resources, rendering the affected systems unable to maintain existing connections or establish new ones. System administrators managing devices with specific build numbers—10.0.22631.3880, 10.0.22621.3880, 10.0.19045.4651, 10.0.19044.4651, and 10.0.22000.3079—should be particularly observant of this issue, as noted in the corresponding KB articles (KB5040442, KB5040431, KB5040427). The denial of service can be persistent or sustained, presenting serious operational challenges for organizations relying on network connectivity for essential services. Addressing this issue as part of regular patch management and system updates is critical to maintaining a stable and secure operational environment.
